The Gilcher was a steel-hulled freighter that went missing on Lake Michigan on 28 October 1892.

Ship: The William C. Moreland was a Great Lakes bulk carrier that ran aground due to poor visibility on Sawtooth Reef, Lake Superior.
The Henry B. Smith was an American bulk freighter that foundered in the Great Lakes Storm of 1913 near Marquette, Michigan. Her wreck was discovered in 2013 by a team of divers led by Jerry Eliason.

A steamship that was wrecked on the rocks.  The 160 passengers and most of the freight were landed on the Oregon shore.[23]  Towed in to drydock at Cascade Locks around September 1.  The hull was found to be a "complete wreck."[24]
